svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To read DTC's detected by the Electronic Control Module (ECM) if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is not available, or if the EST will not communicate with the ECM.

The Cruise Control buttons on the steering wheel act as an interface between the Operator and the ECM. The resulting flashes of the amber ENGINE lamp indicates the ECM is performing a series of electronic tests.

svcsubproc.title: Diagnostic Trouble Code Access Procedure
svcsubproc.para: To display Diagnostic Trouble Codes, set the parking brake and turn the ignition key to the ON position. Press and release the CRUISE ON button and the RESUME/ACCEL button simultaneously .

figure.caption: Cruise Control Buttons on Steering Wheel

svcsubproc.para: When the test is complete, the ECM will flash the red ENGINE lamp and the amber ENGINE lamp to signal the Diagnostic Trouble Codes. Read the Diagnostic Trouble Codes by following the sequence below. This following sequence occurs each time the two Cruise Control buttons are depressed to access the Diagnostic Trouble Codes:

step1.para: The red ENGINE lamp will flash once to indicate the beginning of ACTIVEDTC's.
The amber ENGINE lamp will flash repeatedly signaling the active DTC's.

note.para: All DTC's are three digits. Code 111 indicates no Diagnostic Trouble Codes have been detected.

step1.para: Count the amber flashes in sequence. After each digit of the code a short pause will occur. Three flashes and a pause would indicate number 3. Two flashes, a pause, three flashes, a pause, and two flashes and a pause would indicate Diagnostic Trouble Code 232. If there is more than one DTC, the red ENGINE lamp will flash once indicating the beginning of another active DTC.

svcsubproc.para: After all active DTC's have flashed, the red ENGINE lamp will flash twice to indicate the start of INACTIVE DTC's. Count the flashes from the amber ENGINElamp. If there is more than one inactive code, the red ENGINE lamp will flash once between each DTC.
After all DTC's have been sent, the red ENGINE lamp will flash three times indicating END OF MESSAGE.
To repeat DTC transmission, press and release CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL buttons once. The ECM will once again send the stored DTC's.

item.para: Set park brake (required for correct ESC signal and to clear codes).
Turn key switch to the IGN/ON position.
Depress and hold the CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL buttons simultaneously.
Continue holding the Cruise Control buttons. Depress and release the accelerator pedal three (3) times within a six (6) second interval.

svcsubproc.title: Key-ON Engine-OFF Standard Test and Output Circuit Check (OCC)

step1.para: Set park brake (required for correct ESC signal).
Turn ignition key to the ON position.
Press and release the CRUISE ON and the RESUME/ACCEL buttons simultaneously two (2) times within three (3) seconds.
Key-ON Engine-OFF Standard Test and OCC will run and codes will flash.

item.para: If DTC's are set, see DTC column on Engine Diagnostic Trouble Codes .
